intro: Crinum pratense, commonly known as the meadow crinum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has strap-shaped, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers. Crinum pratense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
